 7544    /** Realizes this MainFrame by setting it visibile and configures the tabbed Pane. Only runs in the event thread. */
 7545  0 public void start() {
 7546   
 7547    // Make the MainFrame visible and show the compiler tab
 7548  0 EventQueue.invokeLater(new Runnable() {
 7549  0 public void run() {
 7550  0 setVisible(true);
 7551  0 _compilerErrorPanel.setVisible(true);
 7552  0 showTab(_compilerErrorPanel, true);
 7553    /* The following two step sequence was laboriously developed by trial and error; without it the _tabbedPane
 7554    * does not display properly. */
 7555  0 _tabbedPane.invalidate();
 7556  0 _tabbedPane.repaint();
 7557   
 7558  0 try {
 7559    // Perform the default imports for the interactions pane
 7560  0 _model.getInteractionsModel().performDefaultImports();
 7561    }
 7562    catch(Throwable t) {
 7563  0 DrJavaErrorHandler.record(t);
 7564    }
 7565    }
 7566    });
 7567    }
 7568   
 7569    /** Sets up the context menu to show in the document pane. */
 7570  43 private void _setUpContextMenus() {
 7571  43 _model.getDocCollectionWidget().addMouseListener(new RightClickMouseAdapter() {
 7572  0 protected void _popupAction(MouseEvent e) {
 7573  0 boolean showContextMenu = true;
 7574  0 if (!_model.getDocumentNavigator().isSelectedAt(e.getX(), e.getY())) {
 7575    // click on a item that wasn't selected, change selection
 7576  0 showContextMenu = _model.getDocumentNavigator().selectDocumentAt(e.getX(), e.getY());
 7577    }
 7578  0 if (showContextMenu) {
 7579  0 boolean rootSelected = _model.getDocumentNavigator().isRootSelected();
 7580  0 boolean folderSelected = false;
 7581  0 boolean docSelected = false;
 7582  0 boolean externalSelected = false;
 7583  0 boolean auxiliarySelected = false;
 7584  0 boolean externalBinSelected = false;
 7585  0 boolean auxiliaryBinSelected = false;
 7586   
 7587  0 final int docSelectedCount = _model.getDocumentNavigator().getDocumentSelectedCount();
 7588  0 final int groupSelectedCount = _model.getDocumentNavigator().getGroupSelectedCount();
 7589  0 try {
 7590  0 java.util.Set<String> groupNames = _model.getDocumentNavigator().getNamesOfSelectedTopLevelGroup();
 7591   
 7592  0 if (docSelectedCount > 0) {
 7593    // when documents are selected, ignore all other options and only deal with documents
 7594  0 rootSelected = false;
 7595  0 if (groupNames.contains(_model.getSourceBinTitle())) {
 7596    // a document in the "[ Source Files ]" bin is selected
 7597  0 docSelected = true;
 7598    }
 7599  0 if (groupNames.contains(_model.getExternalBinTitle())) {
 7600    // a document in the "[ External Files ]" bin is selected
 7601  0 externalSelected = true;
 7602    }
 7603  0 if (groupNames.contains(_model.getAuxiliaryBinTitle())) {
 7604    // a document in the "[ Included External Files ]" bin is selected
 7605  0 auxiliarySelected = true;
 7606    }
 7607    }
 7608    else {
 7609    // no document selected, check other options
 7610  0 if (groupSelectedCount > 0) {
 7611    // at least one folder is selected
 7612  0 if (!_model.getDocumentNavigator().isTopLevelGroupSelected()) {
 7613    // it is really a folder and not a top level bin, e.g. "[ Source Files ]"
 7614  0 folderSelected = true;
 7615    }
 7616    else {
 7617    // it is a top level bin, e.g. "[ Source Files ]"
 7618  0 if (groupNames.contains(_model.getSourceBinTitle())) {
 7619    // the "[ Source Files ]" bin is selected, treat as normal folder
 7620  0 folderSelected = true;
 7621    }
 7622  0 if (groupNames.contains(_model.getExternalBinTitle())) {
 7623    // the "[ External Files ]" bin is selected
 7624  0 externalBinSelected = true;
 7625    }
 7626  0 if (groupNames.contains(_model.getAuxiliaryBinTitle())) {
 7627    // the "[ Included External Files ]" bin is selected
 7628  0 auxiliaryBinSelected = true;
 7629    }
 7630    }
 7631    }
 7632    }
 7633    }
 7634    catch(GroupNotSelectedException ex) {
 7635    // we're looking at the root of the tree, or we're in list view...
 7636  0 if (_model.isProjectActive()) {
 7637    // project view, so the root has been selected
 7638  0 rootSelected = true;
 7639    }
 7640    else {
 7641    // list view, so treat it as simple documents
 7642  0 docSelected = true;
 7643  0 rootSelected = false;
 7644  0 folderSelected = false;
 7645  0 externalSelected = false;
 7646  0 auxiliarySelected = false;
 7647  0 externalBinSelected = false;
 7648  0 auxiliaryBinSelected = false;
 7649    }
 7650    }
 7651   
 7652  0 if (!rootSelected && !folderSelected && !docSelected && !externalSelected &&
 7653    !auxiliarySelected && !externalBinSelected && !auxiliaryBinSelected) {
 7654    // nothing selected, don't display anything
 7655  0 return;
 7656    }

 7878    private volatile Object _updateLock = new Object();
 7879    private volatile boolean _tabUpdatePending = false;
 7880    private volatile boolean _waitAgain = false;
 7881    private volatile Runnable _pendingUpdate = null;

 7883    private volatile OrderedDocumentRegion _firstRegion = null;
 7884    private volatile OrderedDocumentRegion _lastRegion = null;

 7886    public static long UPDATE_DELAY = 500L; // update delay threshold in milliseconds
 7887    public static int UPDATER_PRIORITY = 2; // priority in [1..10] of the updater thread.

 7918

 7928    /** Updates panel displayed in interactions subwindow. */
 7929  84 private void updateUI(OpenDefinitionsDocument doc, int offset) {
 7930  84 assert EventQueue.isDispatchThread();
 7931    // System.err.println("updateUI(" + doc + ", " + offset + ")");
 7932   
 7933  84 Component c = _tabbedPane.getSelectedComponent();
 7934  84 if (c instanceof RegionsTreePanel<?>) {
 7935  0 reloadPanel((RegionsTreePanel<?>) c, doc, offset);
 7936    }
 7937   
 7938    // _lastChangeTime = System.currentTimeMillis(); // TODO: what about changes to file names?
 7939    }
 7940   
 7941    // coarsely update the displayed RegionsTreePanel
 7942  0 private <R extends OrderedDocumentRegion> void reloadPanel(final RegionsTreePanel<R> p,
 7943    final OpenDefinitionsDocument doc,
 7944    int offset) {
 7945   
 7946  0 final RegionManager<R> rm = p._regionManager;
 7947  0 SortedSet<R> regions = rm.getRegions(doc);
 7948  0 if (regions == null || regions.size() == 0) return;
 7949   
 7950    // Adjust line numbers and line bounds if insert involves newline
 7951  0 final int numLinesChangedAfter = doc.getDocument().getAndResetNumLinesChangedAfter();
 7952   
 7953    // interval regions that need line number updating
 7954  0 Pair<R, R> lineNumInterval = null;
 7955   
 7956  0 if (numLinesChangedAfter >= 0) { // insertion/deletion included a newline
 7957    // Update the bounds of the affected regions
 7958   
 7959    // TODO: These casts are bad! R is not always DocumentRegion (of course).
 7960    // The code only works because the RegionManager implementations happen to not strictly
 7961    // require values of type R. Either the interface for RegionManager.updateLines()
 7962    // and RegionManager.reload() needs to be generalized, or a means for creating
 7963    // values that are truly of type R needs to be provided.
 7964  0 @SuppressWarnings("unchecked") R start =
 7965    (R) new DocumentRegion(doc, numLinesChangedAfter, numLinesChangedAfter);
 7966  0 int len = doc.getLength();
 7967  0 @SuppressWarnings("unchecked") R end = (R) new DocumentRegion(doc, len, len);
 7968  0 lineNumInterval = Pair.make(start, end);
 7969    }
 7970   
 7971  0 Pair<R, R> interval = rm.getRegionInterval(doc, offset);
 7972  0 if (interval == null && lineNumInterval == null) return;
 7973   
 7974  0 interval = maxInterval(lineNumInterval, interval);
 7975   
 7976  0 final R first = interval.first();
 7977  0 final R last = interval.second();
 7978   
 7979  0 synchronized(_updateLock) {
 7980  0 if (_tabUpdatePending && _pendingDocument == doc) { // revise and delay existing task
 7981  0 _firstRegion = _firstRegion.compareTo(first) <= 0 ? _firstRegion : first;
 7982  0 _lastRegion = _lastRegion.compareTo(last) >= 0 ? _lastRegion : last;
 7983  0 _waitAgain = true;
 7984  0 return;
 7985    }
 7986    else { // create a new update task
 7987  0 _firstRegion = first;
 7988  0 _lastRegion = last;
 7989  0 _pendingDocument = doc;
 7990  0 _tabUpdatePending = true;
 7991  0 _pendingUpdate = new Runnable() { // this Runnable only runs in the event thread
 7992  0 public void run() {
 7993    // TODO: Bad casts! There's probably no guarantee that R is consistent between invocations,
 7994    // and even if there were, this is a confusing way to go about this process.
 7995    // See above discussion for alternatives.
 7996  0 @SuppressWarnings("unchecked") R first = (R) _firstRegion;
 7997  0 @SuppressWarnings("unchecked") R last = (R) _lastRegion;
 7998  0 rm.updateLines(first, last); // recompute _lineStartPos, _lineEndPos in affected regions
 7999  0 p.reload(first, last); // reload the entries whose length may have changed
 8000  0 p.repaint();
 8001    }
 8002    }; // end _pendingUpdate Runnable
 8003    }
 8004    }
 8005    // Queue a request to perform the update
 8006   
 8007    // Create and run a new aynchronous task that waits UPDATE_DELAY millis, then performs update in event thread
 8008  0 _threadPool.submit(new Runnable() {
 8009  0 public void run() {
 8010  0 Thread.currentThread().setPriority(UPDATER_PRIORITY);
 8011  0 synchronized(_updateLock) {
 8012  0 try { // _pendingUpdate can be updated during waits
 8013  0 do {
 8014  0 _waitAgain = false;
 8015  0 _updateLock.wait(UPDATE_DELAY);
 8016    }
 8017  0 while (_waitAgain);
 8018    }
 8019    catch(InterruptedException e) { /* fall through */ }
 8020  0 _tabUpdatePending = false;
 8021    } // end synchronized
 8022  0 Utilities.invokeLater(_pendingUpdate);
 8023    }
 8024    });
 8025    }
 8026   
 8027  106 public void changedUpdate(DocumentEvent e) { }
 8028  49 public void insertUpdate(DocumentEvent e) {
 8029  49 updateUI(((DefinitionsDocument) e.getDocument()).getOpenDefDoc(), e.getOffset());
 8030    }
 8031  35 public void removeUpdate(DocumentEvent e) {
 8032  35 updateUI(((DefinitionsDocument) e.getDocument()).getOpenDefDoc(), e.getOffset());
 8033    }
 8034    });
 8035   
 8036    // add a listener to update line and column.
 8037  93 pane.addCaretListener(_posListener);
 8038   
 8039    // add a focus listener to this definitions pane.
 8040  93 pane.addFocusListener(new LastFocusListener());
 8041   
 8042    // Add to a scroll pane
 8043  93 final JScrollPane scroll =
 8044    new BorderlessScrollPane(pane, JScrollPane.VERTICAL_SCROLLBAR_AS_NEEDED,
 8045    JScrollPane.HORIZONTAL_SCROLLBAR_AS_NEEDED);
 8046  93 pane.setScrollPane(scroll);
 8047    //scroll.setBorder(null); // removes all default borders (MacOS X installs default borders)
 8048   
 8049  93 if (DrJava.getConfig().getSetting(LINEENUM_ENABLED).booleanValue()) {
 8050  0 scroll.setRowHeaderView(new LineEnumRule(pane));
 8051    }
 8052   
 8053  93 _defScrollPanes.put(doc, scroll);
 8054   
 8055  93 return scroll;
 8056    }
 8057   
 8058  0 private static <R extends OrderedDocumentRegion> Pair<R, R> maxInterval(Pair<R, R> i, Pair<R, R> j) {
 8059  0 if (i == null) return j;
 8060  0 if (j == null) return i;
 8061  0 R i1 = i.first();
 8062  0 R i2 = i.second();
 8063  0 R j1 = j.first();
 8064  0 R j2 = j.second();
 8065   
 8066  0 return Pair.make(i1.compareTo(j1) <= 0 ? i1 : j1, i2.compareTo(j2) >= 0 ? i2 : j2);
 8067    }
 8068   
 8069  38 private void _setUpPanes() {
 8070    // DefinitionsPane
 8071    // JScrollPane defScroll = _defScrollPanes.get(_model.getActiveDocument());
 8072   
 8073    // Try to create debug panel (see if JSwat is around)
 8074  38 if (_showDebugger) {
 8075  38 try {
 8076    // Set the panel's size.

 8114    /** Switch to the JScrollPane containing the DefinitionsPane for the active document. Must run in event thread.*/
 8115  59 void _switchDefScrollPane() {
 8116  59 assert EventQueue.isDispatchThread();
 8117    // demoted to package private protection to test the disabling editing while compiling functionality.
 8118    // and to support brute force fix to DefinitionsPane bug on return from compile with errors
 8119    // Added 2004-May-27
 8120    // Notify the definitions pane that is being replaced (becoming inactive)
 8121  59 _currentDefPane.notifyInactive();
 8122   
 8123    // Utilities.showDebug("_switchDefScrollPane called");
 8124    // Utilities.showDebug("Right before getting the scrollPane");
 8125  59 OpenDefinitionsDocument activeDoc = _model.getActiveDocument();
 8126  59 _currentDefDoc = activeDoc.getDocument();
 8127  59 JScrollPane scroll = _defScrollPanes.get(activeDoc);
 8128   
 8129  26 if (scroll == null) scroll = _createDefScrollPane(activeDoc);
 8130    // Fix OS X scrollbar bug before switching
 8131   
 8132  59 _reenableScrollBar();
 8133   
 8134  59 int oldLocation = _docSplitPane.getDividerLocation();
 8135  59 _docSplitPane.setRightComponent(scroll); //crazy line
 8136  59 _docSplitPane.setDividerLocation(oldLocation);
 8137   
 8138    // if the current def pane is uneditable, that means we arrived here from a compile with errors. We're
 8139    // guaranteed to make it editable again when we return from the compilation, so we take the state
 8140    // with us. We guarantee only one definitions pane is un-editable at any time.
 8141  59 if (_currentDefPane.isEditable()) {
 8142  46 if (_currentDefPane != null) { _currentDefPane.removeFocusListener(_undoRedoDefinitionsFocusListener); }
 8143  46 _currentDefPane = (DefinitionsPane) scroll.getViewport().getView();
 8144  46 _currentDefPane.notifyActive();
 8145  46 _currentDefPane.addFocusListener(_undoRedoDefinitionsFocusListener);
 8146    }
 8147    else {
 8148  13 try { _currentDefPane.setEditable(true); }
 8149    catch(NoSuchDocumentException e) { /* It's OK */ }
 8150   
 8151  13 if (_currentDefPane != null) { _currentDefPane.removeFocusListener(_undoRedoDefinitionsFocusListener); }
 8152  13 _currentDefPane = (DefinitionsPane) scroll.getViewport().getView();
 8153  13 _currentDefPane.notifyActive();
 8154  13 _currentDefPane.setEditable(false);
 8155  13 _currentDefPane.addFocusListener(_undoRedoDefinitionsFocusListener);
 8156    }
 8157    // reset the undo/redo menu items
 8158  59 resetUndo();
 8159  59 _updateDebugStatus();
 8160    }

 8220    /** Addresses Mac OS X bug where the scrollbars are disabled in one document after opening another. */
 8221  66 private void _reenableScrollBar() {
 8222  66 JScrollPane scroll = _defScrollPanes.get(_model.getActiveDocument());
 8223  66 if (scroll == null)
 8224  0 throw new UnexpectedException(new Exception("Current definitions scroll pane not found."));
 8225   
 8226  66 JScrollBar oldbar = scroll.getVerticalScrollBar();
 8227  66 JScrollBar newbar = scroll.createVerticalScrollBar();
 8228  66 newbar.setMinimum(oldbar.getMinimum());
 8229  66 newbar.setMaximum(oldbar.getMaximum());
 8230  66 newbar.setValue(oldbar.getValue());
 8231  66 newbar.setVisibleAmount(oldbar.getVisibleAmount());
 8232  66 newbar.setEnabled(true);
 8233  66 newbar.revalidate();
 8234  66 scroll.setVerticalScrollBar(newbar);
 8235   
 8236    // This needs to be repeated for the horizontal scrollbar
 8237  66 oldbar = scroll.getHorizontalScrollBar();
 8238  66 newbar = scroll.createHorizontalScrollBar();
 8239  66 newbar.setMinimum(oldbar.getMinimum());
 8240  66 newbar.setMaximum(oldbar.getMaximum());
 8241  66 newbar.setValue(oldbar.getValue());
 8242  66 newbar.setVisibleAmount(oldbar.getVisibleAmount());
 8243  66 newbar.setEnabled(true);
 8244  66 newbar.revalidate();

 8246  66 scroll.revalidate();
 8247    }
 8248   
 8249    /** Gets the absolute file, or if necessary, the canonical file.
 8250    * @param f the file for which to get the full path
 8251    * @return the file representing the full path to the given file
 8252    */
 8253  44 private File _getFullFile(File f) throws IOException {
 8254  44 if (PlatformFactory.ONLY.isWindowsPlatform() &&
 8255    ((f.getAbsolutePath().indexOf("..") != -1) || (f.getAbsolutePath().indexOf("./") != -1) ||
 8256    (f.getAbsolutePath().indexOf(".\\") != -1))) {
 8257  0 return f.getCanonicalFile();
 8258    }
 8259  44 return f.getAbsoluteFile();
 8260    }
 8261   
 8262    /** Sets the current directory to be that of the given file. */
 8263  44 private void _setCurrentDirectory(File file) {
 8264    /* We want to use absolute paths whenever possible, since canonical paths resolve symbolic links and can be quite
 8265    * long and unintuitive. However, Windows blows up if you set the current directory of a JFileChooser to an
 8266    * absolute path with ".." in it. In that case, we'll use the canonical path for the file chooser. (Fix for
 8267    * bug 707734) Extended this to fix "./" and ".\" also (bug 774896)
 8268    */
 8269  44 try {
 8270  44 file = _getFullFile(file);
 8271  44 _openChooser.setCurrentDirectory(file);
 8272  44 _saveChooser.setCurrentDirectory(file);
 8273  44 DrJava.getConfig().setSetting(LAST_DIRECTORY, file);
 8274    }
 8275    catch (IOException ioe) {
 8276    // If getCanonicalFile throws an IOException, we can't set the directory of the file chooser. Oh well.
 8277    }
 8278    }
 8279   
 8280    /** Sets the current directory to be that of document's file. */
 8281  57 private void _setCurrentDirectory(OpenDefinitionsDocument doc) {
 8282  57 try {
 8283  57 File file = doc.getFile();
 8284  28 if (file != null) _setCurrentDirectory(file); // if no file, leave in current directory
 8285    }
 8286    catch (FileMovedException fme) {
 8287    // file was deleted, but try to go the directory
 8288  0 _setCurrentDirectory(fme.getFile());
 8289    }
 8290    }

 8304    }

 8306    }

 8414    /** Checks if debugPanel's status bar displays the DEBUGGER_OUT_OF_SYNC message but the current document is
 8415    * in sync. Clears the debugPanel's status bar in this case. Does not assume that frame is in debug mode.
 8416    * Must be executed in event thread.
 8417    */
 8418  66 private void _updateDebugStatus() {
 8419  66 boolean debuggerReady = isDebuggerReady();
 8420  66 _guiAvailabilityNotifier.ensureAvailabilityIs(GUIAvailabilityListener.ComponentType.DEBUGGER, debuggerReady);
 8421  66 if (!debuggerReady) { return; }
 8422   
 8423    // if the document is untitled, don't show that it is out of sync since it can't be debugged anyway
 8424  0 if (_model.getActiveDocument().isUntitled() || _model.getActiveDocument().getClassFileInSync()) {
 8425    // Hide message
 8426  0 if (_debugPanel.getStatusText().equals(DEBUGGER_OUT_OF_SYNC)) _debugPanel.setStatusText("");
 8427    }
 8428    else {
 8429    // Show message
 8430  0 if (_debugPanel.getStatusText().equals("")) {
 8431  0 _debugPanel.setStatusText(DEBUGGER_OUT_OF_SYNC);
 8432    }
 8433    }
 8434  0 _debugPanel.repaint(); // display the updated panel
 8435    }

 8503    /** Blocks access to DrJava while the hourglass cursor is on. */
 8504    private static class GlassPane extends JComponent {
 8505

 8517    * @param shouldHighlight true iff the line should be highlighted. Only done in debugger.
 8518    */
 8519  0 public void scrollToDocumentAndOffset(final OpenDefinitionsDocument doc, final int offset,
 8520    final boolean shouldHighlight) {
 8521  0 scrollToDocumentAndOffset(doc, offset, shouldHighlight, true);
 8522    }
 8523   
 8524  0 public void goToRegionAndHighlight(final IDocumentRegion r) {
 8525  0 assert EventQueue.isDispatchThread();
 8526  0 addToBrowserHistory();
 8527  0 final OpenDefinitionsDocument doc = r.getDocument();
 8528  0 boolean toSameDoc = doc == _model.getActiveDocument();
 8529  0 Runnable command = new Runnable() {
 8530  0 public void run() {
 8531  0 int startOffset = r.getStartOffset();
 8532  0 int endOffset = r.getEndOffset();
 8533  0 doc.setCurrentLocation(startOffset);
 8534  0 _currentLocationHighlight = _currentDefPane.getHighlightManager().
 8535    addHighlight(startOffset, endOffset, DefinitionsPane.THREAD_PAINTER);
 8536  0 _currentDefPane.centerViewOnOffset(startOffset);
 8537  0 _currentDefPane.select(startOffset, endOffset);
 8538  0 _currentDefPane.requestFocusInWindow();
 8539    }
 8540    };
 8541   
 8542  0 if (! toSameDoc) {
 8543  0 _model.setActiveDocument(doc); // queues event actions
 8544  0 _findReplace.updateFirstDocInSearch();
 8545  0 EventQueue.invokeLater(command); // postpone running command until queued event actions complete.
 8546    }
 8547    else {
 8548  0 _model.refreshActiveDocument();
 8549  0 command.run();
 8550    }
 8551  0 EventQueue.invokeLater(new Runnable() { public void run() { addToBrowserHistory(); } }); // after command completes
 8552    }
 8553   
 8554    /** Called when a specific document and offset should be displayed. Must be executed only in the event thread.
 8555    * @param doc Document to display
 8556    * @param offset Offset to display
 8557    * @param shouldHighlight true iff the line should be highlighted.
 8558    * @param shouldAddToHistory true if the location before and after the switch should be added to the browser history
 8559    */
 8560  0 public void scrollToDocumentAndOffset(final OpenDefinitionsDocument doc, final int offset,
 8561    final boolean shouldHighlight, final boolean shouldAddToHistory) {
 8562   
 8563  0 assert duringInit() || EventQueue.isDispatchThread();
 8564   
 8565  0 if (shouldAddToHistory) addToBrowserHistory();
 8566  0 OpenDefinitionsDocument activeDoc = _model.getActiveDocument();
 8567  0 final boolean toSameDoc = (activeDoc == doc);
 8568

 8648  0 synchronized(_debugStepTimer) {

 8652  0 if (! _debugStepTimer.isRunning()) _debugStepTimer.start();
 8653  0 else _debugStepTimer.restart();
 8654    }
 8655    }
 8656    }

 8754    /** Ask the user to increase the slave's max heap setting. */
 8755  0 void askToIncreaseSlaveMaxHeap() {
 8756  0 String value = "set to "+DrJava.getConfig().getSetting(SLAVE_JVM_XMX)+" MB";

 8758    ((OptionConstants.heapSizeChoices.get(0).equals(DrJava.getConfig().getSetting(SLAVE_JVM_XMX))))) {
 8759  0 value = "not set, implying the system's default";
 8760    }
 8761   
 8762  0 String res = (String)JOptionPane.
 8763    showInputDialog(MainFrame.this,
 8764    "Your program ran out of memory. You may try to enter a larger\n" +
 8765    "maximum heap size for the Interactions JVM. The maximum heap size is\n" +
 8766    "currently "+value+".\n"+
 8767    "A restart is required after changing this setting.",
 8768    "Increase Maximum Heap Size?",
 8769    JOptionPane.QUESTION_MESSAGE,
 8770    null,
 8771    OptionConstants.heapSizeChoices.toArray(),
 8772    DrJava.getConfig().getSetting(SLAVE_JVM_XMX));
 8773   
 8774  0 if (res != null) {
 8775    // temporarily make MainFrame the parent of the dialog that pops up
 8776  0 DrJava.getConfig().removeOptionListener(SLAVE_JVM_XMX, _slaveJvmXmxListener);

 8779    // change the setting
 8780  0 DrJava.getConfig().setSetting(SLAVE_JVM_XMX,res.trim());
 8781  0 EventQueue.invokeLater(new Runnable() {
 8782  0 public void run() {
 8783    // reinstall ConfigFrame as parent
 8784  0 DrJava.getConfig().removeOptionListener(SLAVE_JVM_XMX, l);

 9040  57 public void activeDocumentChanged(final OpenDefinitionsDocument active) {
 9041  57 assert EventQueue.isDispatchThread();
 9042    // Utilities.show("MainFrame Listener: ActiveDocument changed to " + active);
 9043    // code that accesses the GUI must run in the event-dispatching thread.
 9044  57 _recentDocFrame.pokeDocument(active);
 9045  57 _switchDefScrollPane(); // Updates _currentDefPane
 9046   
 9047  57 boolean isModified = active.isModifiedSinceSave();
 9048  57 boolean canCompile = (! isModified && ! active.isUntitled());
 9049  57 boolean hasName = ! active.isUntitled();
 9050  57 _saveAction.setEnabled(! canCompile);
 9051  57 _renameAction.setEnabled(hasName);
 9052  57 _revertAction.setEnabled(hasName);
 9053

 9055  57 int pos = _currentDefPane.getCaretPosition();

 9057

 9065    // update display (adding "*") in navigatgorPane

 9067

 9102  0 disableAutomaticTrace();

 9107   
 9108  10 public void interactionEnded() {
 9109  10 assert EventQueue.isDispatchThread();
 9110  10 final InteractionsModel im = _model.getInteractionsModel();
 9111  10 final String lastError = im.getLastError();
 9112  10 final FileConfiguration config = DrJava.getConfig();
 9113  10 if (config != null && config.getSetting(OptionConstants.DIALOG_AUTOIMPORT_ENABLED)) {
 9114  10 if (lastError != null) {
 9115    // the interaction ended and there was an error
 9116    // check that this error is different than the last one (second to last may be null):
 9117  0 final String secondToLastError = im.getSecondToLastError();
 9118  0 if (secondToLastError != null || ! lastError.equals(secondToLastError)) {
 9119    // this aborts the auto-importing if the same class comes up twice in a row
 9120  0 if (lastError.startsWith("Static Error: Undefined class '") && lastError.endsWith("'")) {
 9121    // it was an "undefined class" exception
 9122    // show auto-import dialog
 9123  0 String undefinedClassName = lastError.substring(lastError.indexOf('\'') + 1, lastError.lastIndexOf('\''));
 9124  0 _showAutoImportDialog(undefinedClassName);
 9125    }
 9126  0 else if (lastError.startsWith("Static Error: Undefined name '") && lastError.endsWith("'")) {
 9127    // it was an "undefined name" exception
 9128  0 String undefinedName = lastError.substring(lastError.indexOf('\'') + 1, lastError.lastIndexOf('\''));
 9129   
 9130  0 if ((undefinedName.length() > 0) &&
 9131    (Character.isUpperCase(undefinedName.charAt(0))) &&
 9132    (undefinedName.indexOf('.') >= 0)) {
 9133    // the undefined name starts with a capital letter and contains a dot
 9134    // show auto-import dialog
 9135  0 String undefinedClassName = undefinedName.substring(0, undefinedName.indexOf('.'));
 9136  0 _showAutoImportDialog(undefinedClassName);
 9137    }
 9138    }
 9139  0 else if (lastError.startsWith("java.lang.OutOfMemoryError")) {
 9140  0 askToIncreaseSlaveMaxHeap();
 9141    }
 9142    }
 9143    }
 9144    }
 9145  0 else im.resetLastErrors(); // reset the last errors, so the dialog works again if it is re-enabled
 9146  10 _enableInteractionsPane();
 9147  10 _guiAvailabilityNotifier.available(GUIAvailabilityListener.ComponentType.INTERACTIONS);
 9148  10 _interactionsPane.discardUndoEdits();
 9149   
 9150    }

 9290  0 public void javadocEnded(final boolean success, final File destDir, final boolean allDocs) {
 9291    // Only change GUI from event-dispatching thread
 9292  0 assert EventQueue.isDispatchThread();
 9293    // Utilities.showDebug("javadocEnded: success="+success);
 9294  0 try {
 9295  0 _javadocErrorPanel.getErrorListPane().setJavadocEnded(success);
 9296  0 showTab(_javadocErrorPanel, true);
 9297  0 _javadocErrorPanel.reset();
 9298  0 _model.refreshActiveDocument();
 9299    }
 9300    finally {
 9301  0 _guiAvailabilityNotifier.javadocFinished(); // JAVADOC and COMPILER
 9302  0 hourglassOff();
 9303    }
 9304   
 9305    // Display the results.
 9306  0 if (success) {
 9307  0 String className;
 9308  0 try {
 9309  0 className = _model.getActiveDocument().getQualifiedClassName();
 9310  0 className = className.replace('.', File.separatorChar);
 9311    }
 9312    catch (ClassNameNotFoundException cnf) {
 9313    // If there is no class name, pass the empty string as a flag. We don't want to blow up here.
 9314  0 className = "";
 9315    }
 9316  0 try {
 9317  0 String fileName = (allDocs || className.equals("")) ? "index.html" : (className + ".html");
 9318  0 File index = new File(destDir, fileName);
 9319  0 URL address = FileOps.toURL(index.getAbsoluteFile());
 9320   
 9321  0 if (! PlatformFactory.ONLY.openURL(address)) {
 9322  0 JavadocFrame _javadocFrame = new JavadocFrame(destDir, className, allDocs);
 9323  0 _javadocFrame.setVisible(true);
 9324    }
 9325    }
 9326  0 catch (MalformedURLException me) { throw new UnexpectedException(me); }
 9327    catch (IllegalStateException ise) {
 9328    // JavadocFrame couldn't find any output files!
 9329    // Display a message.
 9330  0 String msg =
 9331    "Javadoc completed successfully, but did not produce any HTML files.\n" +
 9332    "Please ensure that your access level in Preferences is appropriate.";
 9333  0 JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(MainFrame.this, msg,
 9334    "No output to display.",
 9335    JOptionPane.INFORMATION_MESSAGE);
 9336    }
 9337    }
 9338    }

 9389    // event thread. The wait is necessary because compilation process cannot proceed until saving is complete.

 9396    /** Compile all open source files if this option is configured or running as a unit test. Otherwise, pop up a

 9398    */
 9399  0 public void compileBeforeJUnit(final CompilerListener testAfterCompile, List<OpenDefinitionsDocument> outOfSync) {

 9402    // Compile all open source files
 9403  0 _model.getCompilerModel().addListener(testAfterCompile); // listener removes itself
 9404  0 _compileAll();
 9405    }

 9410  0 _model.getCompilerModel().addListener(testAfterCompile); // listener removes itself
 9411  0 _compileAll();
 9412    }
 9413    });
 9414  0 final JButton noButton = new JButton(new AbstractAction("No") {
 9415  0 public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent e) {

 9426    "The files below are out of sync. Would you like to compile all files and<br>"+
 9427    "run the specified test(s)?")

 9446   
 9447    /** Helper method shared by all "saveBeforeX" methods. In JUnit tests, YES option is automatically selected
 9448    * @param message a prompt message to be displayed to the user
 9449    * @param option the BooleanOption for the prompt dialog checkbox
 9450    * @param checkMsg the description of the checkbox ("Always save before X")
 9451    */
 9452  0 private void _saveAllBeforeProceeding(String message, BooleanOption option, String checkMsg) {
 9453    // new ScrollableDialog(null, "saveBeforeProceeding called in MainFrame", "", "").show();
 9454  0 if (_model.hasModifiedDocuments()) {
 9455  0 if (! DrJava.getConfig().getSetting(option).booleanValue() && ! Utilities.TEST_MODE) {
 9456  0 ConfirmCheckBoxDialog dialog =
 9457    new ConfirmCheckBoxDialog(MainFrame.this, "Must Save All Files to Continue", message, checkMsg);
 9458  0 int rc = dialog.show();
 9459   
 9460  0 switch (rc) {
 9461  0 case JOptionPane.YES_OPTION:
 9462  0 _saveAll();
 9463    // Only remember checkbox if they say yes
 9464  0 if (dialog.getCheckBoxValue()) DrJava.getConfig().setSetting(option, Boolean.TRUE);
 9465  0 break;
 9466  0 case JOptionPane.NO_OPTION:
 9467  0 case JOptionPane.CANCEL_OPTION:
 9468  0 case JOptionPane.CLOSED_OPTION:
 9469    // do nothing
 9470  0 break;
 9471  0 default:
 9472  0 throw new RuntimeException("Invalid rc from showConfirmDialog: " + rc);
 9473    }
 9474    }
 9475  0 else _saveAll();
 9476    }
 9477    }

 9483    "Would you like to compile and then run Javadoc?", ALWAYS_COMPILE_BEFORE_JAVADOC,

 9486   
 9487    /** Helper method shared by all "compileBeforeX" methods.
 9488    * @param message a prompt message to be displayed to the user
 9489    * @param option the BooleanOption for the prompt dialog checkbox
 9490    * @param checkMsg the description of the checkbox ("Always compile before X")
 9491    */
 9492  0 private void _compileBeforeProceeding(String message, BooleanOption option, String checkMsg,
 9493    final CompilerListener afterCompile) {
 9494    // new ScrollableDialog(null, "saveBeforeProceeding called in MainFrame", "", "").show();
 9495  0 if (_model.hasOutOfSyncDocuments()) {
 9496  0 if (! DrJava.getConfig().getSetting(option).booleanValue() && ! Utilities.TEST_MODE) {
 9497  0 ConfirmCheckBoxDialog dialog =
 9498    new ConfirmCheckBoxDialog(MainFrame.this, "Must Compile Files to Continue", message, checkMsg);
 9499  0 int rc = dialog.show();
 9500   
 9501  0 switch (rc) {
 9502  0 case JOptionPane.YES_OPTION:
 9503  0 _model.getCompilerModel().addListener(afterCompile); // listener removes itself
 9504  0 _compileAll();
 9505    // Only remember checkbox if they say yes
 9506  0 if (dialog.getCheckBoxValue()) DrJava.getConfig().setSetting(option, Boolean.TRUE);
 9507  0 break;
 9508  0 case JOptionPane.NO_OPTION:
 9509  0 case JOptionPane.CANCEL_OPTION:
 9510  0 case JOptionPane.CLOSED_OPTION:
 9511  0 afterCompile.compileAborted(new RuntimeException("Not compiled."));
 9512  0 break;
 9513  0 default:
 9514  0 throw new RuntimeException("Invalid rc from showConfirmDialog: " + rc);
 9515    }
 9516    }
 9517    else {
 9518  0 _model.getCompilerModel().addListener(afterCompile); // listener removes itself
 9519  0 _compileAll();
 9520    }
 9521    }
 9522    }

 9548    /** Event that is fired with there is nothing to test. JUnit is never started. */
 9549  0 public void nonTestCase(boolean isTestAll, boolean didCompileFail) {
 9550  0 assert EventQueue.isDispatchThread();
 9551   
 9552    // Utilities.showStackTrace(new UnexpectedException("We should not have called nonTestCase"));
 9553  0 String message;
 9554  0 String title = "Cannot Run JUnit Test Cases";
 9555  0 if (didCompileFail) {
 9556  0 message = "Compile failed. Cannot run JUnit TestCases.\n" +
 9557    "Please examine the Compiler Output.";
 9558    }
 9559    else {
 9560  0 if (isTestAll) {
 9561  0 message = "There are no compiled JUnit TestCases available for execution.\n" +
 9562    "Perhaps you have not yet saved and compiled your test files.";
 9563    }
 9564    else {
 9565  0 message = "The current document is not a valid JUnit test case.\n" +
 9566    "Please make sure that:\n" +
 9567    "- it has been compiled and\n" +
 9568    "- it is a subclass of junit.framework.TestCase.\n";
 9569    }
 9570    }
 9571  0 JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(MainFrame.this, message,
 9572    title,
 9573    JOptionPane.ERROR_MESSAGE);
 9574    // clean up as in JUnitEnded
 9575  0 try {
 9576  0 if (!didCompileFail) showTab(_junitPanel, true);
 9577  0 _resetJUnit();
 9578    }
 9579    finally {
 9580  0 hourglassOff();
 9581  0 _guiAvailabilityNotifier.junitFinished(); // JUNIT and COMPILER
 9582    }
 9583    }

 9607    /** Check if the specified document has been modified. If it has, ask the user if he would like to save it
 9608    * and save the document if yes. Also give the user a "cancel" option to cancel doing the operation
 9609    * that got us here in the first place.
 9610    *
 9611    * @return A boolean indicating whether the user cancelled the save process. False means cancel.
 9612    */
 9613  0 public boolean canAbandonFile(OpenDefinitionsDocument doc) {

 9615    }
 9616   
 9617  0 private boolean _fileSaveHelper(OpenDefinitionsDocument doc, int paneOption) {
 9618  0 String text,fname;
 9619  0 OpenDefinitionsDocument lastActive = _model.getActiveDocument();
 9620  0 if (lastActive != doc) _model.setActiveDocument(doc);
 9621   
 9622  0 boolean notFound = false;
 9623  0 try {
 9624  0 File file = doc.getFile();
 9625  0 if (file == null) {
 9626  0 fname = "Untitled file";
 9627  0 text = "Untitled file has been modified. Would you like to save it?";
 9628    }
 9629    else {
 9630  0 fname = file.getName();
 9631  0 text = fname + " has been modified. Would you like to save it?";
 9632    }
 9633    }
 9634    catch (FileMovedException fme) {
 9635    // File was deleted, but use the same name anyway
 9636  0 fname = fme.getFile().getName();
 9637  0 text = fname + " not found on disk. Would you like to save to another file?";
 9638  0 notFound = true;
 9639    }
 9640   
 9641  0 int rc = JOptionPane.showConfirmDialog(MainFrame.this, text, "Save " + fname + "?", paneOption);
 9642  0 switch (rc) {
 9643  0 case JOptionPane.YES_OPTION:
 9644  0 boolean saved = false;
 9645  0 if (notFound) saved = _saveAs();
 9646  0 else saved = _save();
 9647  0 if (doc != lastActive) {
 9648  0 _model.setActiveDocument(lastActive); // breaks when "if" clause omitted
 9649    }
 9650  0 return saved;
 9651  0 case JOptionPane.NO_OPTION:
 9652  0 if (doc != lastActive) {
 9653  0 _model.setActiveDocument(lastActive); // breaks when "if" clause omitted
 9654    }
 9655  0 return true;
 9656  0 case JOptionPane.CLOSED_OPTION:
 9657  0 case JOptionPane.CANCEL_OPTION:
 9658  0 return false;
 9659  0 default: // never executed
 9660  0 throw new RuntimeException("Invalid option: " + rc);
 9661    }
 9662    }
 9663   
 9664    /** Check if the current document has been modified. If it has, ask the user if he would like to save it
 9665    * and save the document if yes.
 9666    * @return true if quitting should continue, false if the user cancelled
 9667    */
 9668  0 public boolean quitFile(OpenDefinitionsDocument doc) {
 9669  0 return _fileSaveHelper(doc, JOptionPane.YES_NO_CANCEL_OPTION);
 9670    }

 9686    "Would you like to reload it and discard any changes you have made?";

 9850  0 model.reload();

 9852  0 p.repaint();
 9853    }
 9854   
 9855  1 _tabbedPane.setSelectedComponent(c);

 9931    /** Builds the Hashtables in KeyBindingManager that record key-bindings and support live updating, conflict
 9932    * resolution, and intelligent error messages (the ActionToNameMap). IMPORTANT: Don't use this mechanism to put
 9933    * an action into the KeyBindingManager if the action is a menu item because menu actions are already included.
 9934    * Putting in again will cause bug #803304 "Uncomment lines wont rebind".
 9935    */
 9936  38 private void _setUpKeyBindingMaps() {
 9937  38 final ActionMap actionMap = _currentDefPane.getActionMap();
 9938  38 final KeyBindingManager kbm = KeyBindingManager.ONLY;
 9939   
 9940  38 kbm.put(KEY_BACKWARD, actionMap.get(DefaultEditorKit.backwardAction), null, "Cursor Backward");
 9941  38 kbm.put(KEY_BACKWARD_SELECT, actionMap.get(DefaultEditorKit.selectionBackwardAction), null,
 9942    "Cursor Backward (Select)");
 9943   
 9944  38 kbm.put(KEY_BEGIN_DOCUMENT, actionMap.get(DefaultEditorKit.beginAction), null, "Cursor Begin Document");
 9945  38 kbm.put(KEY_BEGIN_DOCUMENT_SELECT, actionMap.get(DefaultEditorKit.selectionBeginAction), null,
 9946    "Cursor Begin Document (Select)");
 9947   
 9948  38 kbm.put(KEY_BEGIN_LINE, _beginLineAction, null, "Cursor Begin Line");
 9949  38 kbm.put(KEY_BEGIN_LINE_SELECT, _selectionBeginLineAction, null, "Cursor Begin Line (Select)");
 9950   
 9951  38 kbm.put(KEY_PREVIOUS_WORD, actionMap.get(DefaultEditorKit.previousWordAction), null,
 9952    "Cursor Previous Word");
 9953  38 kbm.put(KEY_PREVIOUS_WORD_SELECT, actionMap.get(DefaultEditorKit.selectionPreviousWordAction), null,
 9954    "Cursor Previous Word (Select)");
 9955   
 9956  38 kbm.put(KEY_DOWN, actionMap.get(DefaultEditorKit.downAction), null, "Cursor Down");
 9957  38 kbm.put(KEY_DOWN_SELECT, actionMap.get(DefaultEditorKit.selectionDownAction), null, "Cursor Down (Select)");
 9958   
 9959  38 kbm.put(KEY_END_DOCUMENT, actionMap.get(DefaultEditorKit.endAction), null, "Cursor End Document");
 9960  38 kbm.put(KEY_END_DOCUMENT_SELECT, actionMap.get(DefaultEditorKit.selectionEndAction), null,
 9961    "Cursor End Document (Select)");
 9962   
 9963  38 kbm.put(KEY_END_LINE, actionMap.get(DefaultEditorKit.endLineAction), null, "Cursor End Line");
 9964  38 kbm.put(KEY_END_LINE_SELECT, actionMap.get(DefaultEditorKit.selectionEndLineAction), null,
 9965    "Cursor End Line (Select)");
 9966   
 9967  38 kbm.put(KEY_NEXT_WORD, actionMap.get(DefaultEditorKit.nextWordAction), null, "Cursor Next Word");
 9968  38 kbm.put(KEY_NEXT_WORD_SELECT, actionMap.get(DefaultEditorKit.selectionNextWordAction), null,
 9969    "Cursor Next Word (Select)");
 9970   
 9971  38 kbm.put(KEY_FORWARD, actionMap.get(DefaultEditorKit.forwardAction), null, "Cursor Forward");
 9972  38 kbm.put(KEY_FORWARD_SELECT, actionMap.get(DefaultEditorKit.selectionForwardAction), null, "Cursor Forward (Select)");
 9973   
 9974  38 kbm.put(KEY_UP, actionMap.get(DefaultEditorKit.upAction), null, "Cursor Up");
 9975  38 kbm.put(KEY_UP_SELECT, actionMap.get(DefaultEditorKit.selectionUpAction), null, "Cursor Up (Select)");
 9976   
 9977    // kbm.put(KEY_NEXT_RECENT_DOCUMENT, _nextRecentDocAction, null, "Next Recent Document");
 9978    // kbm.put(KEY_PREV_RECENT_DOCUMENT, _prevRecentDocAction, null, "Previous Recent Document");
 9979   
 9980    // These last methods have no default selection methods

 9983  38 kbm.put(KEY_CUT_LINE, _cutLineAction, null, "Cut Line");
 9984  38 kbm.put(KEY_CLEAR_LINE, _clearLineAction, null, "Clear Line");

 9986  38 kbm.put(KEY_SHIFT_DELETE_NEXT, actionMap.get(DefaultEditorKit.deleteNextCharAction), null, "Delete Next");
 9987    }

 10085    static {

 10087  0 catch(ClassNotFoundException cnfe) { uriListFlavor = null; }

 10100    /** User dropped something on the component. */
 10101  0 public void drop(DropTargetDropEvent dropTargetDropEvent) {
 10102  0 assert EventQueue.isDispatchThread();
 10103  0 try {
 10104  0 Transferable tr = dropTargetDropEvent.getTransferable();
 10105  0 if (tr.isDataFlavorSupported(DataFlavor.javaFileListFlavor) ||
 10106    ((uriListFlavor != null) && (tr.isDataFlavorSupported(uriListFlavor)))) {
 10107  0 dropTargetDropEvent.acceptDrop(DnDConstants.ACTION_COPY_OR_MOVE);
 10108  0 List<File> fileList;
 10109  0 if (tr.isDataFlavorSupported(DataFlavor.javaFileListFlavor)) {
 10110  0 @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
 10111    List<File> data = (List<File>) tr.getTransferData(DataFlavor.javaFileListFlavor);
 10112  0 fileList = data;
 10113    }
 10114    else {
 10115    // work-around for Linux drag-and-drop; see Java bug 4899516
 10116  0 String data = (String) tr.getTransferData(uriListFlavor);
 10117  0 fileList = textURIListToFileList(data);
 10118    }
 10119  0 java.util.Iterator<File> iterator = fileList.iterator();
 10120  0 List<File> filteredFileList = new ArrayList<File>();
 10121  0 while (iterator.hasNext()) {
 10122  0 File file = iterator.next();
 10123  0 if (file.isFile() && (DrJavaFileUtils.isSourceFile(file) || file.getName().endsWith(".txt"))) {
 10124  0 filteredFileList.add(file);
 10125    }
 10126  0 else if (file.isFile() && file.getName().endsWith(OptionConstants.EXTPROCESS_FILE_EXTENSION)) {
 10127  0 openExtProcessFile(file);
 10128    }
 10129    }
 10130  0 final File[] fileArray = filteredFileList.toArray(new File[filteredFileList.size()]);
 10131  0 FileOpenSelector fs = new FileOpenSelector() {
 10132  0 public File[] getFiles() { return fileArray; }
 10133    };
 10134  0 open(fs);
 10135  0 dropTargetDropEvent.getDropTargetContext().dropComplete(true);
 10136    }
 10137    else {
 10138  0 dropTargetDropEvent.rejectDrop();
 10139    }
 10140    }
 10141    catch(IOException ioe) {
 10142  0 ioe.printStackTrace();
 10143  0 dropTargetDropEvent.rejectDrop();
 10144    }
 10145    catch (UnsupportedFlavorException ufe) {
 10146  0 ufe.printStackTrace();
 10147  0 dropTargetDropEvent.rejectDrop();
 10148    }
 10149    }
 10150   
 10151    /** Open stand-alone external process file. */
 10152  0 public static void openExtProcessFile(File file) {
 10153  0 try {
 10154  0 XMLConfig xc = new XMLConfig(file);
 10155  0 String name = xc.get("drjava/extprocess/name");
 10156  0 ExecuteExternalDialog.addToMenu(name, xc.get("drjava/extprocess/cmdline"),
 10157    xc.get("drjava/extprocess/workdir"), "");
 10158  0 JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(null, "The installation was successful for:\n"+name,
 10159    "Installation Successful", JOptionPane.INFORMATION_MESSAGE);
 10160    // We override the drjava/extprocess/enclosingfile and set it to the empty string ""
 10161    // because this external process did not come from a *.djapp file that was a JAR file.
 10162    }
 10163    catch(XMLConfigException xce) {
 10164    // this wasn't an XML file, try to treat it as a jar file
 10165  0 openExtProcessJarFile(file);
 10166    }
 10167    }
 10168   
 10169    /** Open external process file in a jar file. */
 10170  0 public static void openExtProcessJarFile(File file) {
 10171  0 try {
 10172  0 JarFile jf = new JarFile(file);
 10173  0 JarEntry je = jf.getJarEntry(EXTPROCESS_FILE_NAME_INSIDE_JAR);
 10174  0 InputStream is = jf.getInputStream(je);
 10175  0 XMLConfig xc = new XMLConfig(is);
 10176  0 String name = xc.get("drjava/extprocess/name");
 10177  0 ExecuteExternalDialog.addToMenu(name, xc.get("drjava/extprocess/cmdline"),
 10178    xc.get("drjava/extprocess/workdir"), file.getAbsolutePath());
 10179  0 JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(null, "The installation was successful for:\n"+name,
 10180    "Installation Successful", JOptionPane.INFORMATION_MESSAGE);
 10181    // We override the drjava/extprocess/enclosingfile and set it to the file specified
 10182    // because this external process came from a *.djapp file that was a JAR file.
 10183  0 is.close();
 10184  0 jf.close();
 10185    }
 10186    catch(IOException ioe) { /* ignore drop */ }
 10187    catch(XMLConfigException xce) { /* ignore drop */ }
 10188    }
 10189   
 10190    /** Convert a string with URIs to a list of files.
 10191    * @param data string with URIs
 10192    * @return list of files
 10193    */
 10194  0 private static List<File> textURIListToFileList(String data) {
 10195  0 List<File> list = new ArrayList<File>();
 10196  0 StringTokenizer st = new StringTokenizer(data, "\r\n");
 10197  0 while(st.hasMoreTokens()) {
 10198  0 String s = st.nextToken();
 10199  0 if (s.startsWith("#")) continue; // the line is a comment (as per the RFC 2483)
 10200  0 try {
 10201  0 java.net.URI uri = new java.net.URI(s);
 10202  0 File file = new File(uri);
 10203  0 list.add(file);
 10204    }
 10205    catch (java.net.URISyntaxException e) { /* malformed URI*/ }
 10206    catch (IllegalArgumentException e) { /* the URI is not a valid 'file:' URI */ }
 10207    }
 10208  0 return list;
 10209    }
 10210

 10223    }
 10224    };

 10230  0 public void run() {
 10231  0 openProject(openSelector);
 10232    }
 10233    });
 10234    }

 10236  0 final int l = lineNo;
 10237  0 Utilities.invokeLater(new Runnable() {
 10238  0 public void run() {
 10239  0 open(openSelector);
 10240  0 if (l>=0) {
 10241  0 _jumpToLine(l);
 10242    }

 10349    /** Imports a class. */
 10350  0 private void _showAutoImportDialog(final String s) {

 10353  0 public void run() {
 10354    // run this in a thread other than the main thread
 10355  0 final Set<JavaAPIListEntry> apiSet = getJavaAPISet();
 10356  0 if (apiSet == null) {
 10357  0 hourglassOff();
 10358  0 return;
 10359    }
 10360   
 10361  0 Utilities.invokeLater(new Runnable() {
 10362  0 public void run() {
 10363    // but now run this in the event thread again
 10364  0 List<JavaAPIListEntry> autoImportList = new ArrayList<JavaAPIListEntry>(apiSet);
 10365  0 if (DrJava.getConfig().getSetting(DIALOG_COMPLETE_SCAN_CLASS_FILES).booleanValue() &&
 10366    _autoImportClassSet.size() > 0) {
 10367  0 autoImportList.addAll(_autoImportClassSet);
 10368    }
 10369    else {

 10374  0 if (d.isUntitled()) continue;

 10377  0 String full = rel.replace(File.separatorChar, '.');

 10381  0 if (full.endsWith(ext)) {
 10382  0 full = full.substring(0, full.lastIndexOf(ext));
 10383  0 break;
 10384    }
 10385    }
 10386  0 String simple = full;
 10387  0 if (simple.lastIndexOf('.') >= 0) simple = simple.substring(simple.lastIndexOf('.') + 1);
 10388

 10390  0 if (! autoImportList.contains(entry)) { autoImportList.add(entry); }
 10391    }
 10392    catch(IOException ioe) { /* ignore, just don't add this one */ }
 10393    catch(SecurityException se) { /* ignore, just don't add this one */ }
 10394    }
 10395    }
 10396    }

 10404    }

 10415    /** Open a file for following (like using "less" and F). Only runs in the event thread. */
 10416  0 private void _followFile() {
 10417  0 updateStatusField("Opening File for Following");
 10418  0 try {
 10419  0 final File[] files = _openAnyFileSelector.getFiles();
 10420  0 if (files == null) { return; }
 10421  0 for (final File f: files) {
 10422  0 if (f == null) continue;
 10423  0 String end = f.getName();
 10424  0 int lastIndex = end.lastIndexOf(File.separatorChar);
 10425  0 if (lastIndex >= 0) end = end.substring(lastIndex+1);
 10426  0 final LessPanel panel = new LessPanel(this, "Follow: "+end, f);
 10427  0 _tabs.addLast(panel);
 10428  0 panel.getMainPanel().addFocusListener(new FocusAdapter() {
 10429  0 public void focusGained(FocusEvent e) { _lastFocusOwner = panel; }
 10430    });
 10431  0 panel.setVisible(true);
 10432  0 showTab(panel, true);
 10433  0 _tabbedPane.setSelectedComponent(panel);
 10434    // Use EventQueue.invokeLater to ensure that focus is set AFTER the findResultsPanel has been selected
 10435  0 EventQueue.invokeLater(new Runnable() { public void run() { panel.requestFocusInWindow(); } });
 10436    }
 10437    }
 10438    catch(OperationCanceledException oce) { /* ignore */ }
 10439    }

 10489   
 10490    /** Return the modal window listener if available, otherwise returns a non-modal dummy listener.
 10491    * Note that the WindowEvent passed to the toFrontAction runnable may not be the WindowEvent that
 10492    * caused the window w to be pushed off the front, it may also be the WindowEvent that restores
 10493    * w as front window after a modal dialog that trumped w was closed.
 10494    * @param w window trying to get the modal window listener
 10495    * @param toFrontAction action to be performed after the window has been moved to the front again
 10496    * @param closeAction action to be performed when the window is closing
 10497    */
 10498  0 public void installModalWindowAdapter(final Window w, final Runnable1<? super WindowEvent> toFrontAction,
 10499    final Runnable1<? super WindowEvent> closeAction) {
 10500  0 assert EventQueue.isDispatchThread();
 10501   
 10502  0 if (_modalWindowAdapters.containsKey(w)) { // already installed
 10503  0 return;
 10504    }
 10505   
 10506  0 WindowAdapter wa;
 10507  0 if (_modalWindowAdapterOwner == null) {
 10508    // modal listener is available, claim it
 10509  0 _modalWindowAdapterOwner = w;
 10510    // create a window adapter performs the specified actions after delegating to the modal window adapter
 10511  0 wa = new WindowAdapter() {
 10512    final HashSet<Window> trumpedBy = new HashSet<Window>();
 10513    // set of windows that trumped this window in getting to the front
 10514    final WindowAdapter regainFront = new WindowAdapter() {
 10515  0 public void windowClosed(WindowEvent we) {
 10516    // the window that trumped w was closed, so we're moving w back to the front
 10517  0 w.toFront();
 10518  0 w.requestFocus();
 10519  0 toFrontAction.run(we);
 10520    // then we remove the window that trumped w from the set of trump windows
 10521  0 Window o = we.getOppositeWindow();
 10522  0 if (o != null) {
 10523  0 trumpedBy.remove(o);
 10524    // and we remove this listener
 10525  0 o.removeWindowListener(this);
 10526    }
 10527    }
 10528    };
 10529    final WindowAdapter regainFrontAfterNative = new WindowAdapter() {
 10530  0 public void windowActivated(WindowEvent we) {
 10531    // remove from the three windows this is installed on
 10532  0 MainFrame.this.removeWindowListener(this);
 10533  0 _tabbedPanesFrame.removeWindowListener(this);
 10534  0 if (_debugFrame != null) _debugFrame.removeWindowListener(this);
 10535    // if the window that lost focus because of a native application window
 10536    // is still the modal window adapter owner, put it back in front
 10537  0 if (_modalWindowAdapterOwner==w) {
 10538  0 w.toFront();
 10539  0 w.requestFocus();
 10540  0 toFrontAction.run(we);
 10541    }
 10542    }
 10543    };
 10544  0 public void toFront(WindowEvent we) {
 10545  0 Window opposite = we.getOppositeWindow();
 10546  0 if (opposite == null) {
 10547    // Probably a native application window, not DrJava.
 10548    // When the user switches back to DrJava, the user may select
 10549    // a different window to be on top, but we want w to be on top
 10550    // install a listener on MainFrame, the detached panes window, and the
 10551    // detached debugger that puts w back on top if one of those windows
 10552    // gets selected and w is still the modal window adapter owner.
 10553    // This isn't perfect, since the user may select a window other than
 10554    // those three, but it is good enough in most cases since those three
 10555    // windows are the biggest windows.
 10556  0 MainFrame.this.addWindowListener(regainFrontAfterNative);
 10557  0 _tabbedPanesFrame.addWindowListener(regainFrontAfterNative);
 10558  0 if (_debugFrame != null) _debugFrame.addWindowListener(regainFrontAfterNative);
 10559  0 return;
 10560    }
 10561  0 if (opposite instanceof Dialog) {
 10562  0 Dialog d = (Dialog)opposite;
 10563  0 if (d.isModal()) {
 10564    // the other window is a real modal dialog, we'll leave it on top -- the window trumped this window
 10565  0 if (!trumpedBy.contains(d)) {
 10566    // add a listener to move this window back to the front when the opposite window has been closed
 10567  0 d.addWindowListener(regainFront);
 10568    // add trump window to set of windows that have trumped this window
 10569  0 trumpedBy.add(d);
 10570    }
 10571  0 return;
 10572    }
 10573    }
 10574  0 we.getWindow().toFront();
 10575  0 we.getWindow().requestFocus();
 10576  0 toFrontAction.run(we);
 10577    }
 10578  0 public void windowDeactivated(WindowEvent we) { toFront(we); }
 10579  0 public void windowIconified(WindowEvent we) { toFront(we); }
 10580  0 public void windowLostFocus(WindowEvent we) { toFront(we); }
 10581  0 public void windowClosing(WindowEvent we) { closeAction.run(we); }
 10582    };
 10583    }
 10584    else {
 10585    /* The modal listener is already owned by another window. The code block creates a window adapter that performs
 10586    * closeActions but not toFrontActions because the latter could generate an endless loop with this window
 10587    * competing with the modal listener window to stay on top.
 10588    */
 10589  0 wa = new WindowAdapter() {
 10590  0 public void windowDeactivated(WindowEvent we) { }
 10591  0 public void windowIconified(WindowEvent we) { }
 10592  0 public void windowLostFocus(WindowEvent we) { }
 10593  0 public void windowClosing(WindowEvent we) { closeAction.run(we); }
 10594    };
 10595    }
 10596    // install it
 10597  0 _modalWindowAdapters.put(w, wa);
 10598  0 w.addWindowListener(wa);
 10599  0 w.addWindowFocusListener(wa);
 10600    }
 10601   
 10602    /** Removes the modal window adapter.
 10603    * @param w window releasing the modal window adapter
 10604    */
 10605  0 public /* synchronized */ void removeModalWindowAdapter(Window w) {
 10606  0 assert EventQueue.isDispatchThread();
 10607  0 if (! _modalWindowAdapters.containsKey(w)) return; // the specified window does not have a modal windowadapter
 10608   
 10609  0 w.removeWindowListener(_modalWindowAdapters.get(w));
 10610  0 w.removeWindowFocusListener(_modalWindowAdapters.get(w));
 10611  0 _modalWindowAdapterOwner = null;
 10612  0 _modalWindowAdapters.remove(w);
 10613    }
 10614    }
